message: Looks like Editor 216...is here all day policing this entry trying to accentuate the critical remarks of otherwise very positive reviews to paint them as majority negative. Positive reviews always make critical remarks, which are already well cited, but these should not be emphasized over what are clearly a positive reviews.
This is a more accurate summation of Northup's review, which is very positive, even though Duchesne is challenging the multicultural view of world history that Northrup advocates.
minor typos corrected

Unnecessary commentary about reasons why University of Waterloo cancelled Faith Goldy event, in which protests were triggered by Faith Goldy's participation, not by Duchesne. The current paragraph is more than enough about an event that was cancelled.

Added another reference to a review of Uniqueness, and changed wording about Duchesne's ties to white nationalism so it avoids the prosecutor style of prior editor, and follows Wiki guidelines for using neutral-objective language.
Added changes that more accurately portray the controversial nature of Duchesne
Added review of Uniqueness by professor Grant Havers

Deleted a few lines with links to articles in Duchesne's blogs that no longer exist. The allegations in these lines refer to comments Duchesne apparently made about David Irving and blacks but  I could not find any of these comments. Not a good idea to use comments in Duchesne's blog as legitimate sources. I transferred Duchesne's blurb about The White Nationalist Manifesto to this section, as better evidence of his white nationalism..
Added one review of Uniqueness of Western Civ with the source.
Undid revision 1049604714 by [[Special:Contributions/Antoinexv|Antoinexv]] ([[User talk:Antoinexv|talk]])
corrected link to Eric Jones review.
Undid revision 1049602633 by [[Special:Contributions/Antoinexv|Antoinexv]] ([[User talk:Antoinexv|talk]]) link does not work
Added a link to review of The Uniqueness of Western Civilization by Eric Jones
Added reference to "Dissertation Prize"

Undid revision 1049218370 by [[Special:Contributions/104.222.122.15|104.222.122.15]] ([[User talk:104.222.122.15|talk]]) I just checked, there is a "Dissertation Prize", Policy approved by the Faculty of Graduate Studies Council, January 7, 1993: https://www.yorku.ca/gradstudies/students/current-students/thesis-and-dissertation/thesis-and-dissertation-prizes/
Added references to published reviews of The Uniqueness of Western Civilization by economic historian Eric Jones and Steve Balch. Deleted line lacking documentary sources.
Important to note that Jang was strongly criticized for raising a People's Republic of China national flag on the grounds of the Vancouver City Hall.
I brought up assessment of Duchesne's case by expert on academic mobbing Kenneth Westhues.
clarified the thesis of Uniqueness; used more precise words from one of the reviewers of this book.

We can strongly object to Duchesne's views, but there is nothing incoherent about differentiating white identity politics from white nationalism. In Canada in Decay he explains that the principles of multiculturalism allow for identity politics for all races. He does not argue in favor of a Canada exclusively for whites, which is white nationalism.
Indicated that Duchesne wrote a reply to Elvin.

Editor 216...is deleting all the sentences about The Uniqueness book which refer to verifiable reviews in academic journals, trying to repeat in every paragraph the same accusation that Duchesne is a white nationalist, which has been heavily documented already.  He clearly has some personal vendetta against Duchesne rather following Wiki guidelines on proper use of sources.

Editor 216...is deleting everything that was written about Uniqueness, inserting his own personal views instead, taking out all the links and words from peer reviewed journals, so as to emphasized only Duchesne's politics, rather than academics.

Undid revision 1052428811 by [[Special:Contributions/216.154.55.113|216.154.55.113]] ([[User talk:216.154.55.113|talk]]) Prior editor 216...now wants do undo everything done last 3 weeks, mostly by himself, so he portray Duchesne in one dimensional way, knowing that Uniqueness did get very good reviews.

I included a Wikipedia link to the term "European Canadians". I shortened reference to Faith Goldy that was not relevant. I included a more relevant talk that Ricardo Duchesne and Mark Hecht gave in October 2019 that was met by dozens of protesters.
Clarified the position of Ricardo Duchesne regarding his "white identity politics" as stated in his blog, and as Professor Frances Widdowson identified his politics.

corrected link to Eric Jones review. In previous edit, I added Jones's concluding thoughts about Duchesne's book, reflecting a review that was very positive, about 80/20 in favor, not 50/50, using words by Jones.  This is what makes Duchesne controversial, not only that he is white nationalist but an academic as well.

The person who revised the section dealing with Jones's review committed a major infraction citing words from Jones which he never expressed, while deleting actual words from the review. I cited correct words, deleted false citation of words from Jones.
I mentioned the lecture Duchesne gave at UBC in 2018 introduced by Lindsay Shepherd, with a link.
I made reference to a recent (2018) statement Prof Widdowson made in an interview about Duchesne's "white identity politics".

I deleted claim that Ricardo Duchesne wrote for Daily Stormer. It is well known that the Stormer had a habit of picking up articles from other blogs without permission. I deleted redundant sentence that he participated in AltRight interviews. This is already well documented.
I added some actual words from Eric Jones, avoided ascribing statements to Jones that he did not make. Important to stay accurate. Inserted some words and reference to a review of Canada in Decay.
/* Biographical Information and Career overview */ additional biographical information re his family of origin
/* The Uniqueness of Western Civilization */ Elvin review
/* Biographical Information and Career overview */ correcting and adding to biographical information
/* The Uniqueness of Western Civilization */ correcting typo
/* The Uniqueness of Western Civilization */ corrected spelling of Roy Bin Wong's name, added link to his wikipedia page
/* Biographical Information and Career overview */ adding biographical information

Undid revision 1052347791 by [[Special:Contributions/Antoinexv|Antoinexv]] ([[User talk:Antoinexv|talk]]) - This kind of extension belongs, if anywhere, in the body of the article, not in the brief introductory paragraph. The part about his views on diversity that Prof Duchesne has inserted is puffery rather than substance, and the introduction is not the part where he should go into an extended description on legal provisions concerning multiculturalism.

/* Subsequent work */ Removed incoherent claim that multicultural white identity politics is different from white nationalism. Duchesne advocates fighting for white identity politics using multiculturalist policies, but there is no indication in his writings that he sees this as different from white nationalism. The distinction makes no sense; white nationalism is a belief system while using multiculturalist policies is only  a tactic, and it is an insult to attribute such obfuscation to him.
making subheadings more uniform in style
moving paragraph to end of previous section
/* Subsequent work */ additions re publications and activities
/* The Uniqueness of Western Civilization */ adding footnote re subsequent publications
/* Subsequent work */ Commas
/* Biographical Information and Career Overview */ adding biographical information

Alter: title, url, pages. URLs might have been anonymized. Add: ssrn, title. Changed bare reference to CS1/2. Removed parameters. Formatted [[WP:ENDASH|dashes]]. | [[WP:UCB|Use this bot]]. /* Subsequent work */ correcting misleading typos in Widdowson reference
/* Subsequent work */ making intro more concise by moving overly-long sections to the body of the article, replacing them with a self-descriptive quote from the subject of the article.
/* The Uniqueness of Western Civilization */ balancing references to Northrup review
/* Reception */ activities since retirement

Undid revision 1052043792 by [[Special:Contributions/Barnes692|Barnes692]] ([[User talk:Barnes692|talk]])This would be relevant only if Duchesne was responding to Jang's action; but there is no source that says there is any connection between the two, and in that sense it is misleading. It is also unfair, in that Jang was only one of the people who participated in the flag raising ceremony, which was actually a semi-official even in which the local MP also took part.
/* The Uniqueness of Western Civilization */ including the criticisms in Havers' review of Uniqueness to balance the praise he also gave the book, to give a more balanced perspective.
/* Reception */ balancing allegation that critics have no scholarly background in his field
Duplicate word removed

/* The Uniqueness of Western Civilization */ rationalizing the section on reception of the book while preserving the quotes containing fulsome praise of it, and reducing the excessive length devoted to the Jones review.
/* The Uniqueness of Western Civilization */ including reference to further review of book, to give a more balanced view of its reception.
